result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clarence M Pryor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clarence M Pryor in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Clarence M Pryor.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2, 3, AND 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Court vacated jury trial. 
 Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-26-2022
Received and Filed: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Received and Filed: Jury Instructions
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Clarence M Pryor in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Clarence M Pryor.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court set plea hearing for 8:30 am on the date of the scheduled jury trial.  Jury trial remains scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-15-2022

Defendant Clarence M Pryor in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-11-2022
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: State's Requested Jury Instructions
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine

Defendant Clarence M Pryor in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Court set final pre-trial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 7-21-2022 and all responses to be filed by 8-11-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.23.22

Defendant Clarence M Pryor in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.3.22
Received and Filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 042499,
Payable Number: 1003860,
Receipt Number: 22RP017695,
Amount: $20.00

22RM021367  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4-24-2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving.

Defendant Clarence M Pryor in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Clarence M Pryor in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Clarence M Pryor appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3 and 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
